description: The round payoff this round was 98. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 49.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) yields the highest individual payoff when both players act in alignment

The game resembles a coordination dilemma where players must align on the same strategy to maximize payoffs, with (1,1) being the Pareto-optimal equilibrium and (2,2) a suboptimal but stable alternative

Trust and predictability are critical, as unilateral deviation to option 2 risks either a moderate payoff (if the other cooperates) or zero (if the other defects), creating incentives to maintain cooperative behavior
The presence of multiple equilibria (1,1 and 2,2) highlights the importance of establishing and maintaining mutual expectations to sustain high-payoff outcomes
